sections.title: HIPAA OVERVIEW
sections.content: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) establishes national standards for protecting patients' medical records and other personal health information. As a covered entity or business associate using the KROA dental management system, you must comply with HIPAA requirements.

sections.title: PROTECTED HEALTH INFORMATION (PHI)
sections.content:
PHI includes any individually identifiable health information held or transmitted by a covered entity or its business associates, including:

‚Ä¢ Patient demographics and contact information
‚Ä¢ Medical and dental records
‚Ä¢ Treatment plans and clinical notes
‚Ä¢ Billing and insurance information
‚Ä¢ Appointment schedules
‚Ä¢ Digital images and X-rays
‚Ä¢ Any information that could identify a patient

sections.title: MINIMUM NECESSARY STANDARD
sections.content:
You must limit access to PHI to the minimum necessary to accomplish the intended purpose. This includes:

‚Ä¢ Implementing role-based access controls
‚Ä¢ Limiting user permissions based on job functions
‚Ä¢ Regularly reviewing and updating access permissions
‚Ä¢ Training staff on minimum necessary principles
‚Ä¢ Documenting access controls and procedures

sections.title: SECURITY REQUIREMENTS
sections.content:
You must implement administrative, physical, and technical safeguards:

‚Ä¢ Administrative: Designate a security officer, conduct risk assessments, train workforce
‚Ä¢ Physical: Control facility access, protect workstations, secure media and equipment
‚Ä¢ Technical: Implement access controls, audit logs, encryption, and secure transmission
‚Ä¢ Regular security updates and patches
‚Ä¢ Incident response procedures

sections.title: BREACH NOTIFICATION
sections.content:
In case of a security incident or breach involving PHI, you must:

‚Ä¢ Conduct immediate risk assessment
‚Ä¢ Notify affected patients within 60 days
‚Ä¢ Report to HHS within 60 days
‚Ä¢ Notify media if breach affects 500+ individuals
‚Ä¢ Maintain documentation of the breach and response
‚Ä¢ Implement corrective measures to prevent future breaches

sections.title: PATIENT RIGHTS
sections.content:
Patients have the right to:

‚Ä¢ Access their PHI and request copies
‚Ä¢ Request amendments to their records
‚Ä¢ Request restrictions on use and disclosure
‚Ä¢ Request alternative communication methods
‚Ä¢ File complaints about privacy practices
‚Ä¢ Receive notice of privacy practices

sections.title: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE AGREEMENT
sections.content:
KROA serves as a business associate and commits to:

‚Ä¢ Use PHI only as permitted by this agreement
‚Ä¢ Implement appropriate safeguards
‚Ä¢ Report security incidents promptly
‚Ä¢ Return or destroy PHI when contract ends
‚Ä¢ Allow covered entity to monitor compliance
‚Ä¢ Ensure subcontractors meet same standards

sections.title: COMPLIANCE ACKNOWLEDGMENT
sections.content:
By accepting this agreement, you acknowledge:

‚Ä¢ Understanding of HIPAA requirements
‚Ä¢ Commitment to implement required safeguards
‚Ä¢ Responsibility for staff training and compliance
‚Ä¢ Obligation to report security incidents
‚Ä¢ Understanding that violations may result in civil and criminal penalties
‚Ä¢ Agreement to cooperate with compliance audits and investigations
